Posts.Content: I was really dizzy when I had FEC. So bad my GP came out. they said that my BP was normal and it was probably the shock to the system or/and the injections you have to boost your white blood count. Melx
Posts.Title: 2 fec feeling dizzy

Posts.Content: I too am 2 years down the line. There is life after BC, it does get easier. Every day I used to think about what I'd been through and would it come back, but now it's not so much a part of my every day. We are all very brave. xx
Posts.Title: Two year milestone reached

Posts.Content: this is so me! I was diagnosed July 2013, grade 3 aggressive but not spread. It feels like ever since diagnosis I ache and always fear it coming back. I live life totally and appreciate small things much more, but it doesn't take much to knock me back. I have a very sore elbow which doctor says is tennis elbow and sore shoulder blade and a new one is sore neck. It's not one thing on top of another it's one thing after another. Terrible disease which no one who hasn't had it can understand the mental anguish. I can't find any courses etc in my area (Kent) but I trudge on with the help of my very supportive husband. I too have met lots of lovely people. Try to look for the positives. It's hard, but they are there. xxxxÂ
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer Nov 14'. Lumpectomy no spread in lymph...

Posts.Content: Since finishing chemo and radiotherapy I have been a nervous wreck thinking its spread. My oncologist insists I'm ok as the cancer was cut out and chemo was belts and braces but the grade 3 scares me. Currently on tamoxifen.
Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: Hair will grow back how ever awful it is without it. Do anything to keep the cancer away. Good luck in your decision. Xx
Posts.Title: CMF OR FEC WITH A COLD CAP?
